author: Nicole Gagneux
comment: I know the concept of each entry. I need to know I spent 100 dollars on play store apps, or on food. Without that, I can't migrate from Expense Manager. (And believe me, I WANT to migrate to your app because it's beautiful and super promising.)
title: I love this app, but I can't use it unless

comment: It is a really promising expense app. I would love to see features like labels, accounts, payment methods, recurring transactions and option to add reminders to planned transactions.

reply.author: Radium
reply.content: Thanks for your feedback, some of those features are on our roadmap already. We're trying to make things as easy as possible and not just give you 1001 fields to fill, so it might take some time before everything is done properly.

title: Gorgeous design but lacks functionality.

author: T Hassall
comment: I would love to be able to set a spend for a month or set categories for spending, e.g. transport, food and drink, leisure, and that these could be customised to suit the user. This should then allow me to work out how much I spend on transport each week / month. That would be amazing. A widget for quick input would be nice, similar to the Google Keep one where you select the type of note you want to add, then it opens the app. If there is a beta community, please point me at it!
title: Great but could do a little more

author: Rizki S.
comment: Although there's some feature missing, this app is beautifully designed and I really love the execution of it's ideas. Looking forward for more features in the future updates !
title: Good Start

author: Ali Tabatabaei
comment: No categories or labels or anything! which data is more useful: how much do I spend on wednesdays or how much I did I spend on clothes last month? This app gives you the former but not the latter!  Android Wear functionality is limited to ONLY voice input.

author: Ice white
comment: It looks great. it can export as CSV. but I didn't find a way to import CSV. please fix it
title: How can I import CSV?

author: Vincent Chen
comment: pretty good while i need label or consumption description features， still appreciate your work
title: gorgeous

author: Praneil Jadhav
comment: Option to add note in transaction is missing

reply.author: Radium
reply.content: Thanks for your feedback - we'll add this feature in next release

author: myron revellame
comment: Need more features like auto sync on google drive.
title: Good start

author: Richard Lai
comment: It's a very useful app.
title: Cool app

author: Justin.R. Jobs
comment: Easy！

author: Chuck
comment: I love the simplicity of this app. I got it primarily for my watch and love being able to quickly dictate the amount I spent and move on with my busy day! For some reason I don't get numbers on my watch, just blank screens with only titles, though the graph shows activity. It seems as the the dollar amount is in white text against a white background perhaps? On my phone, my average daily spending is always $0, though the entire are listed. Other than that, I love it!

reply.author: Radium
reply.content: Thanks for reporting! We'll take a look at this issue

title: No Numbers on Moto 360?

author: Thomas Hetland
comment: This is very good, almost exactly how i wanted a spending app like this to be, one thing i would love to see is being able to input numbers and currency on wear devices like the moto 360, without having to use voice!
title: So close

author: Kamila Součková
comment: I want to be able to track what I used the money for -- allowing me to add categories (like food, transportation, ...) would be awesome.  Also, a little numpad on the watch would often be more useful than voice input.
title: Needs categories

author: Joseph Howard
comment: Great app! Going to Keep me from going over board at the club! Watch out ladies, I ain't spending nothing! Lol. How do I activate the Android Wear functionality? I have a Moto 360.

reply.author: Radium
reply.content: Hi Joseph, thanks for feedback :) On your Wear device you can open How Much app to add spending using your voice. Also, after first usage on Wear you'll have daily reports about your spending on your wrist.

title: Awesome

author: Chandler Anderson
comment: Attractive and does what it says it does. No complaints at all so far.  It would be nice to see a manual entry feature on the Android Wear app, though. Is that in the works?

reply.author: Radium
reply.content:
Hi Chandler,
There is no manual entry as for now, but we'll consider adding it.
Thanks for your feedback!

title: Nice app!

author: Andrew Ednie
comment: Really simple and easy to use. I especially like the android wear integration. What it really needs is a way to export my data. I'd be willing to pay if there was an export option.

reply.author: Radium
reply.content: We want to add an option to export in Exel-format in a future release. If you have any suggestions about additional export formats, then write us a mail (if not troublesome).

title: Export

author: Rolle
comment: This is close what I've been looking for. I need an app like SpendToday on iPhone. Day to income, daily calculations and that's it. Would be the game changer, please do consider it.
title: Really close

author: Marc-David Meijer
comment: Nice app with a great interface. However, is there an option to remove an entry?

reply.author: Radium
reply.content: Yes, there is:) To remove an entry you should press "View all spending" in the bottom of a screen with cards. A list with all spending will show up. Now, just swipe to remove undesirable entry. Thanks for feedback.

title: Nice app!

author: Kush Patel
comment: Helpful
title: Good one
